title: Arrays - Static and Dynamic
description: Learn how to store and manage collections of data using arrays

content.introduction:
Arrays allow you to store multiple values of the same type in a single variable. Think of an array as a numbered list of items, where each item can be accessed by its position (index).

In this lesson, you'll learn about both static arrays (fixed size) and dynamic arrays (variable size).

### What You'll Learn
- Declaring static and dynamic arrays
- Accessing array elements using indices
- Iterating through arrays with loops
- Common array operations
- Working with multi-dimensional arrays

concepts.title: Static Arrays
concepts.description: Fixed-size arrays declared with a specific size. The size cannot change during program execution. Syntax: array[start..end] of Type

concepts.title: Dynamic Arrays
concepts.description: Variable-size arrays that can grow or shrink. Declared without size specification. Use SetLength to resize. Syntax: array of Type

concepts.title: Array Indexing
concepts.description: Access elements using square brackets and an index. Static arrays can have any starting index, dynamic arrays always start at 0

concepts.title: Array Length
concepts.description: Use Length() function to get the number of elements. For dynamic arrays, use SetLength() to change size

examples.title: Static Array Basics
examples.description: Declare and use a fixed-size array

examples.title: Dynamic Array
examples.description: Create and use a dynamic array with SetLength

exercises.title: Temperature Tracker
exercises.description: Create a program that stores 7 daily temperatures in an array and calculates the highest, lowest, and average temperature.
hints: Use variables to track the highest and lowest temperatures
Initialize highest and lowest with the first array element
Use a for loop to iterate through all temperatures
Compare each temperature with current highest/lowest
Calculate sum while iterating, then divide by 7 for average

exercises.title: Dynamic Shopping List
exercises.description: Create a shopping list using a dynamic array that stores 5 items and displays them in a numbered list.
hints: Use SetLength to set the array size to 5
Remember that dynamic arrays start at index 0
Use Length(items) - 1 as the upper bound in your loop
Add 1 to the index when displaying to show numbers 1-5 instead of 0-4

exercises.title: Reverse Array
exercises.description: Create a program that stores numbers in an array and displays them in reverse order.
hints: Use a for loop with 'downto' instead of 'to'
Start from the highest index (5) and go down to 1
You can use Write instead of WriteLn to print on the same line

content.summary:
Excellent! You've learned about arrays:

- **Static arrays** with fixed size: `array[1..5] of Integer`
- **Dynamic arrays** with variable size: `array of Integer`
- Using `SetLength()` to resize dynamic arrays
- Accessing elements with indices: `myArray[i]`
- Getting array length with `Length()`
- Iterating through arrays with for loops
- Working with multi-dimensional arrays

Arrays are essential for managing collections of related data efficiently!
